revised_title: New Developments in the Ergodic Theory of Nonlinear Dynamical Systems
tldr: The article discusses recent advancements in the ergodic theory of nonlinear dynamical systems, focusing on the study of chaotic behavior and strange attractors. It explores the He'non map, attractors, metric descriptions, and the one-dimensional case of the quadratic family of maps. The authors aim to understand the statistical properties and invariant measures of these systems, which are essential for describing their behavior.
